required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Caregiver Burden and Distress in Hematopoeitic Stem Cell Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Hematopoeitic Stem Cell Transplantation on Primary Caregiver Level of Burden and Distress

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the impact that serving as a caregiver for a patient undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplant has on the caregiver. This will include looking at the caregiver's level of burden, depression, anxiety, somatic symptoms, fatigue and overall distress. It will also look at whether caregiver burden leads to an increase in hospitalization and overall outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Brief Symptom Inventory and Burden Interview
primary_outcome.description: Brief Symptom Inventory (BSI) measures overall distress. Scores can range from 0-72 with the higher score representing a higher level of distress. Each question is 0-4 with 4 being higher levels of distress. Clinically significant level of distress is 25+. Burden Interview is scored on a continuum. No clinically range, but higher scores mean higher feelings of burden. Scores range from 0-88. Time frame: BSI scores and Burden scores were compared in caregivers of HSCT patients at preBMT and post BMT (30 days and 1 year).

secondary_outcome.description: BSI scale 0-72 with the higher score representing higher distress Brief Fatigue inventory 0-90 with the higher score representing higher fatigue Brief Pain inventory 0-120 with the higher score representing higher pain
Number of patients who are alive at 1 year
12 demographic characteristics were collected. If common characteristics were found then it would have been analyzed for correlation with caregiver burden and distress

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be an autologous patient and their caregiver and an allogeneic patient and their caregiver

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patient:
- Any patient undergoing autologous or allogeneic HSCT at The Blood and Marrow Transplant Program at Northside Hospital
- Patients must have a single primary caregiver
- Patients must be willing to comply with all assessments as outlined in the protocol
- Patients must be willing to sign informed consent
Caregiver:
- Must be the primary caregiver for an autologous or allogenic HSCT patient at the Blood and Marrow Transplant Program at Northside Hospital
- Caregiver must be willing to comply will all assessments as outlined in the protocol
- Caregiver must be willing to sign consent

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients will be selected from our Program and will be undergoing evaluation for stem cell transplant.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients and caregivers were enrolled as dyads. Data was collected from both patients and caregivers.

group.title: Patients Undergoing Autologous Transplant
group.description: 50% of patients enrolled in this study will be undergoing autologous transplant with one primary caregiver.

group.title: Patients Undergoing Allogeneic Transplant
group.description: 50% of patients enrolled in this study will be undergoing allogeneic transplant with one primary caregiver.

group.title: Autologous Transplant
group.description: 50 pairs of autologous patients and their caregivers were enrolled

group.title: Allogeneic Transplant
group.description: 50 pairs of allogeneic patients and their caregivers were enrolled

measure.title: Age
measure.population: 2 autologous caregivers and 4 allogeneic caregivers did not complete their age on the demographics page. Total autologous included = 48. Total allogeneic included = 46

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

Each question is 0-4 with 4 being higher levels of distress. Clinically significant level of distress is 25+. Burden Interview is scored on a continuum. No clinically range, but higher scores mean higher feelings of burden. Scores range from 0-88. Time frame: BSI scores and Burden scores were compared in caregivers of HSCT patients at preBMT and post BMT (30 days and 1 year).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
